This is an [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. 

Try executing this chunk by clicking the *Run* button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing *Cmd+Shift+Enter*. 


```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# load libraries
#df <- read_excel("~/Downloads/Engineering_graduate_salary.xlsx")
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(GGally)
```

```{r}
#load data frames
df <- read_excel("~/Downloads/Engineering_graduate_salary.xlsx")
```

```{r}
#inspect data frames
head(df)
```

```{r}
data <- df
hist(
  df$collegeGPA, col="red", main="Histogram of College GPA", xlab="College GPA", border="black"
)

```

```{r}
plot(
  df$ComputerScience, df$collegeGPA, ylab="College GPA", xlab="Computer Science", col="red"
)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = collegeGPA, y = CollegeCityID, color = CollegeState)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .5) + theme(plot.background=element_rect(fill="light blue")) 
```

```{r}
# Menampilkan korelasi antar kombinasi pasangan fitur dataset
data %>%
  select(collegeGPA, CollegeCityID, CollegeID) %>%
  ggpairs(
    title="Plot berbagai data", lower=list(continuous=wrap("smooth", alpha= 0.3, size=0.1))
  )
```

```{r}
# Membuat plot densitas dengan melibatkan warna untuk fitur tertentu  
ggplot(data, aes(x = Salary, color = Gender, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_density(alpha = .10) +
  scale_x_log10(breaks = c(50, 100, 150, 200) * 500, labels = scales::dollar_format(2)) + theme(axis.text=element_text(size=8))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = factor(Degree), color = Degree, y = English)) +
  geom_boxplot(outlier.colour="black", outlier.shape=16, outlier.size=1, notch=TRUE) 
#notch untuk memperlihatkan median dengan jelas
```
